ABOUT

Heejun Kim

üìç Gwangju Institute of Science and Technology (GIST)

Major: Electrical Engineering & Computer Science
Minor: AI & Mathematics

Mail | CV | GitHub | Google Scholar

I am a senior undergraduate student at GIST with a deep fascination for AGI, LLM reasoning, LLM alignment, and test-time scaling. My research focuses on understanding how intelligent systems can improve their reasoning capabilities through interaction and adaptation.

Currently, I am conducting research on LLM with reinforcement learning at the Data Science Laboratory under Prof. Sundong Kim's supervision, working towards achieving artificial general intelligence.

Through the Korea-Germany Junior Research Fellowship, I had the opportunity to work as a visiting researcher at Forschungszentrum J√ºlich's INM-7 institute directed by Prof. Simon B. Eickhoff, where I investigated the intersection of neuroscience and machine learning through brain connectivity analysis.

Research Experience

Data Science Lab - Research Assistant

Feb 2025 - Present, Jan 2024 - June 2024

Supervised by Prof. Sundong Kim

  • Developed architecture applying generative models to reinforcement learning for Abstract Reasoning Corpus (ARC)
  • Researched test-time adaptation with reinforcement learning for self-improving reasoning capabilities of large language models
Forschungszentrum J√ºlich - Visiting Researcher

Host Institute: INM-7 directed by Prof. Simon B. Eickhoff and contributed to Mathematical Neuroscience Group led by Dr. Oleksandr Popovych

  • Researched MRI processing on disease classification and prediction by machine learning
  • Developed preprocessing pipeline for multi-modal MRI human connectome data from Parkinson's patient data (PPMI) using High-Performance Computing (HPC) and HyperThreading technology (Project Supervisor: Dr. Kyesam Jung)
  • Korea-Germany Junior Research Fellowship 2024 organized by Max Planck Korea
